definition: to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself

sentences.english: I wolfed the whole two pounds of bread without stopping to take breath.
sentences.chinese: 我狼吞虎嚥地一口氣把整整兩磅麪包幹掉了。

sentences.english: The hungry man devoured his dinner.
sentences.chinese: 那餓漢狼吞虎嚥地把飯喫光了。

sentences.english: Don't gobble down your food. It'll make you fat if you do.
sentences.chinese: 喫東西時切忌狼吞虎嚥，這可能會讓你發胖。

sentences.english: I saw a beggar wolf down a piece of bread in the street yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我看見一個乞丐在街上狼吞虎嚥地喫一塊麪包。

sentences.english: Everyone attend to not up so many, with avidity eat right away.
sentences.chinese: 大家都顧不上這麼多，馬上狼吞虎嚥地喫起來。

sentences.english: He gorged himself at the party.
sentences.chinese: 在宴會上他狼吞虎嚥地把自己塞飽。

sentences.english: You should have seen him mop up the beer.
sentences.chinese: 你真該看看他那狼吞虎嚥地喝啤酒的樣子。

sentences.english: Having rubbed his hands on the body, he began to stuff.
sentences.chinese: 在身上蹭了蹭手後，他便開始狼吞虎嚥地喫起來。

sentences.english: He wolfed down his breakfast and left.
sentences.chinese: 他狼吞虎嚥地喫下早飯就走了。

sentences.english: I was so hungry that I wolfed down my meal.
sentences.chinese: 我餓得狼吞虎嚥地喫飯。

sentences.english: But that doesn't mean you need scoff pasta at every meal.
sentences.chinese: 但這並不意味着你每一頓都要狼吞虎嚥地進食麪食。

sentences.english: Don't wolf down your food. Eat slower.
sentences.chinese: 不要狼吞虎嚥，喫慢一點。

sentences.english: He took the nutriment eagerly, to he get eaten nothing since dawn.
sentences.chinese: 他狼吞虎嚥地喫，應該他從清早起什麼也沒喫。

sentences.english: We scarfed down several hamburgers after the movie.
sentences.chinese: 我們看完電影之後狼吞虎嚥吃了好幾個漢堡。

sentences.english: He ate the remains of food hungrily.
sentences.chinese: 他狼吞虎嚥地喫剩餘的食物。

sentences.english: That boy grasped foods and ate them likes wolf.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子一把抓過食物，狼吞虎嚥般地吃了下去。

definition: to eat one's fill/to be full
to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
produce/fresh fruits and vegetables/fresh aquatic food/fresh herbs
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
